Samuel wrote:
> Heres my situation:
> Everyday I run a crawl (about 300 seeds) based on a recovery of a job
> that took a week on its first crawl. Since I tried unsuccessfuly
> running a script to create this job based on a recover.gz file (see
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/2764), 
> <http://groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/2764%29,> Im now
> considering the checkpoint facility. 
What kind of issues did you run into Sam?

> I read somewhere in the user
> manual something about the checkpoint operation thru JMX, but I
> couldnt do it since theres no such operation. 
There has to be a running job for you to see the CrawlJob MBean, the 
bean with the checkpoint operation.  Even still, its hard to find.  Look 
after the long list of Attributes and you'll see:

....
 startCheckpoint: Start a checkpoint
  Parameters 0, return type=java.lang.Void
...


The operation name is 'startCheckpoint' and takes no arguments.


> Also theres the
> automated checkpointing by setting the
> org.archive.crawler.framework.Checkpointer.period attribute at the
> heritrix.properties file. But it doesnt allow me to execute it after
> crawling has finished (and it wouldnt make any sense, I know). 

You could set the pause-at-finish flag and then checkpoint (But if the 
job is done, when you recover, there'll be nothing to crawl.  Or are you 
introducing new seeds on recovery?).

> So, is
> there any way to do it?
> Would it be easier to add 'recovery' as a parameter for the operation
> addJobBasedOn in JMX?
Just setting the recovery-path to point at checkpoint directory in the 
order file you submit should be all thats required.  Let us know if this 
doesn't work for you.

St.Ack
